text:
Spa tourism revenues in UAE to reach US $495 million by 2019
Spa tourism in UAE is shining with reports showing that the UAE spa market is on a steady growth. The spa market in UAE is forecasted to earn revenues worth US$411 million, Euromonitor International report for The Leisure Show Dubai reveals.
Report by the Global Wellness Institute (GWI) echoes similar figures highlighting the top spot of UAE in spa tourism in the Middle East and North Africa with visitor numbers set to double by 2017.
Euromonitor forecast spa revenues in the UAE will reach US $495 million by 2019.
This year world-class pool and spa suppliers will be in Dubai for the 2nd annual The Leisure Show and the Middle East Pool and Spa Awards 2015 in September.
GWI identifies UAE as “growth powerhouse” leading the MENA region in spa tourism which is only behind Sub-Saharan Africa. UAE’s spa tourism is set to add just under 1 million trips from 2012-17.
Susie Ellis, Chairman and CEO of GWI said: “The Global Wellness Institute estimates that the top spa growth powerhouse, more than doubling wellness- focused trips from 2012-2017, will be the UAE, with 993,352 trips added and 17.9% annual growth.”
The luxury day spa, hotel spa and spa resort “explosion” in GCC countries has been cited as a major factor behind the region’s spa market boom by GWI.
